level.text: A chiropractor who is licensed to practice in the District of Columbia under the provisions of this chapter may provide the following chiropractic services:
Locating, diagnosing, and analyzing subluxated vertebrae as follows:
By x-ray of the spinal column;
By employing other non-invasive procedures such as MRI and CAT scan;
Correcting vertebral subluxation displacement by applying specific localized force to the spine;
Advising patients about diet, exercise and stress;
Referring patients for specialized diagnostic testing, which may be necessary for chiropractic treatment or patient safety;
Referring patients to other healthcare practitioners as deemed necessary by the chiropractor; and
Diagnosing and treating bodily articulations by means of manipulation or adjustments.

A chiropractor who is certified by the Board to perform ancillary procedures pursuant to ยง 4803.3 may perform any physiotherapy for which the chiropractor has received specialized training at a program or institution listed in ยง 4807.1 as long as the physiotherapy is preparatory and complementary to chiropractic care.
